title: Qweirdo presents: Spectrum
description:
QWeirdo are braving the January cold for another takeover of the Corner House’s LGBTQ Night! As always, we’ll be showcasing some of the best women and enby performers & DJs the Cambridge queer scene has to offer, with

Incredible performances from:
Comic CHARLIE GIVERNY //
Drag King TOBIAS //
Drag King ALMA FELLA //

Followed by indie electronic/dance DJ sets from:
ZΔΣ //
CHARLIE GIVERNY //
DJ BICHFASE //

The Corner House LGBTQ night is run by the community for the community, and this month we’re fundraising for the upcoming Stonewall festival, marking the 50 year anniversary of the riots. So if you can, please bring some pennies for our collection tins!

ENTRY: £3 before 10pm // £5 after 10pm

FYI
– This night showcases LBTQ women and NB performers, but is for all LGBTQ folx regardless of gender or stripe of the rainbow.

– The Corner House has wheelchair access via the rear entrance, but unfortunately no fully accessible toilet.

– The toilets are single-cubicle, on a flat level, and one of the cubicles is quite spacious.

– There is a well-lit second room with chairs, tables and a door which can be closed to reduce background noise from the dance area.

– There is sometimes a cat at the venue.

QWeirdo is an initiative by Queer Women in Cambridge, a community platform for all LBTQ+ women and non-binary people in and around Cambridge based on an ethos of radical inclusion.
